title: Trump talks up potential deals with China, Iran
text:
Getty Images President Donald Trump shows reporters a map of a predicted path of Hurricane Dorian following a briefing from officials in the Oval Office at the White House on Wednesday.

President Donald Trump on Wednesday talked up potential agreements with China and Iran, and said he had no role in Vice President Mike Pence’s stay at a Trump property in Ireland.

CHINA

Speaking to reporters after getting a briefing on Hurricane Dorian, Trump said China wanted to make a trade deal but “we’ll see what happens.”

His comments came a day after he warned Beijing against dragging its feet in making an agreement with the U.S. As he has previously, Trump claimed that the stock market would be 10,000 points higher if he hadn’t confronted China. He declined to directly address allegations by Chinese tech giant Huawei that the U.S. had tried to infiltrate its information systems.

Answering a question about the possibility China could unload its U.S. debt TMUBMUSD10Y, -2.57% amid the trade tensions, Trump said he wasn’t worried at all since “we could refinance that very easily.” China is currently the No. 2 holder of U.S. bonds, behind Japan. “We’ve never been in a position where we’ve had more people wanting to invest in our bonds,” Trump said.

U.S. stocks ended solidly higher thanks in part to the potential for new stimulus measures in China and the easing of tensions in Hong Kong. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -1.94% rose 237 points, while the S&P 500 index SPX, -1.89% climbed 31 points and the Nasdaq COMP, -1.71% rose 102 points.

Read: Dow rises more than 200 points as Hong Kong tensions ease, China signals stimulus.

IRAN

The president also said it was possible he would meet with Iranian President Hassan Rouhani at the United Nations General Assembly this month in New York.

“We’re going to see what happens,” Trump said. “They want to talk. They want to make a deal. Iran is not the same country they were 2½ years ago.” Trump withdrew the U.S. from the Obama-era nuclear deal with Iran and has said he’s willing to meet Rouhani, but not drop U.S. sanctions.

Rouhani has rejected meeting Trump as long as sanctions remain in place.

PENCE’S IRELAND STAY

Trump denied he had suggested that Pence stay at the Trump International Golf Links and Hotel in Doonbeg, Ireland. The two-night stay has drawn fire from ethics watchdogs. Pence’s chief of staff had said the vice president stayed there at Trump’s suggestion. But Wednesday the president said he had “no involvement.”

Separately, Trump said the government was using “much less here than anticipated” in responding to Dorian and that help is needed at the border. Last week, the administration announced it would shift $271 million from within the Department of Homeland Security to help pay for more immigration detention beds at the southern border. Democrats slammed that decision.
